This is another incarnation of bug 136750, and will only occur when welcome has to resort to the forms-based implementatoin (because your browser is not properly configured).

Maxime - you're getting the not-as-pretty backup welcome; if you configure your browser you'll see a whole different experience :-)

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 136750 ***

(In reply to comment #1)
> Maxime - you're getting the not-as-pretty backup welcome; if you configure your
> browser you'll see a whole different experience :-)
Curtis, I thought it was... I manage to get the help open my browser of choice, but the welcome page does not seem to pick it up. (Used Preferences/General/Web Browser - tried Firefox and Epiphany).

> Curtis, I thought it was... I manage to get the help open my browser of choice,
> but the welcome page does not seem to pick it up. (Used Preferences/General/Web
> Browser - tried Firefox and Epiphany).

Maxime, you are confusing external browser selection (which obviously works for help). Welcome uses embedded browser instance that is Mozilla on Linux. When this embedded instance is loaded, browser can be shown inside the workbench like any other SWT widget. You can read SWT FAQ from http://eclipse.org/swt on how to get it to work.

Nevertheless, this is a bug in SWT welcome and needs to be fixed.

> Maxime, you are confusing external browser selection (which obviously works for
> help). Welcome uses embedded browser instance that is Mozilla on Linux. When
> this embedded instance is loaded, browser can be shown inside the workbench
> like any other SWT widget. You can read SWT FAQ from http://eclipse.org/swt on
> how to get it to work.
I fixed my env variable and it works, thx.
